article_title: What Doctors Aren't Learning In Medical School And Why It Matters

article_metadata.description: By Stephen Klasko, MD, MBA In the 1960s, America’s doctor was Marcus Welby, a family physician who made house calls, didn’t charge patients who couldn’t afford it, and maybe even delivered a calf on the side of the road—all before performing difficult neurosurgery on a child before the end of the [...]
article_metadata.author: athenahealth
